I don't think there's any actual official guidelines (perhaps some is needed?) so it basically boils down to the individual view of whoever looks at your game to categorise it.

For me I sort of think 'would I be happy for a ten year old to be looking at it?' I don't know how others go about it.

There is an adult category for adult games - the sandpit is for demos, broken and unfinished games. A broken adult game might end up in the sand pit which seems daft as kids would then still be able to access it.
